ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about technical methods of drawing such as plum lines and perspective. Moving into the digital taught me to pay more attention to composition and foreground-background relationships.
I learned more about the foundations of drawing, animation, and virtual reality!
Fresco, Illustrator, collaging, animation, virtual reality, abstraction, figure background relationships, and what it means to complicate that.
Drawing from observation on the iPad, abstract collage, digital and real-life watercolor, stop-motion animation, VR 3D drawing
Brief introduction to basic drawing skills and experience working with the Adobe suite.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed the lessons on laser cutting and mixed media.
It was very well-organized and I felt like there was a lot of helpful critique and understanding from Professor V!

I really did enjoy the projects and what I got out of the course. It is not a course where you just learn how to use some digital tools, but one that opens you up to a new way of thinking. I think I just became much more loose with my art by the end of the semester.

In-class work time and critiques were super helpful for getting instructor feedback and spurring along progress on projects. The projects are diverse, open-ended, and fun. You learn a lot of new skills and the prompts give you a new perspective.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course - it's a ton of fun, you learn a lot, and professor V is great!
Yes, if they are interested in working or learning about digital tools.
Yes! Prof. Vossoughi is an amazing professor! She creates such a friendly learning environment where everyone regardless of their art background can participate and contribute!
I. would definitely recommend this course to another student. As someone who has never taken an art class here, it got me to think a lot more about the process of creating a basic composition.
Yes! I learned so much about how to use technologies to supplement my current art skills
